entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 05 at 1:46PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A STORM FORCE LOW FOR NEXT WEEK... A strong low over the Gulf of Alaska looks to bring a storm force front to the panhandle for the middle of the week. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 5:21AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN HUMBOLDT COUNTY THROUGH 545 AM PST... HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 05 at 8:46PM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .Downstream flow on the Saint Johns River near Astor remains hindered due to persistent northerly winds and tides. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 3:54AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty winds expected Today... A strong low pressure system will move through the Great Lakes today. Secure any outdoor items may be easily blown about.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 5:49AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Periods of Snow Today... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Periods of snow. Accumulations of 3 to 6 inches through tonight, with higher amounts possible on western facing slopes above 9000 feet.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 5:49AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Periods of Snow through tonight.. This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Periods of snow. Accumulations of 3 to 6 inches through tonight, with higher amounts possible above 9500 feet. Lower amounts are expected along South Pass.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Wind River Mountains East; Wind River Mountains West

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 5:49AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Periods of Snow through tonight.. This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Periods of snow. Accumulations of 3 to 5 inches through tonight. * WHERE...The Salt and Wyoming Range.
